text: [Music]
every one so if you've been here since
last year you probably know that well
one I live in New Orleans and two that I
am currently a member of the Krewe of
Nyx if you're not familiar crews are
pretty much a social like organization
that throw parades Nix is one of
the bigger ones and we have our own
specialty throws some other examples of
the specialty throws that other crews
throw are like to prove Zulu they throw
decorated coconuts group iris throws
sunglasses and the Krewe of Nyx we throw
decorated purses so last year I did I
think one video where I decorated my
purses and I showed you guys what I did
this year I don't think I'm gonna do
that but I did want to show how you can
make the little glitter transfer things
that I made to put onto my purses it
makes it really easy to just like whip
up a design and then you can peel it off
and stick it on your purse whereas the
alternative is trying to do it straight
on to the purse and if you mess up then
you have to deal with it at least with
the transfers if you mess up then you
could either wipe it away if it's still
wet or you could just start on another
piece of the plastic and then scrap the
other design anyway I thought that I
would show you guys how you can make
those I'm gonna be making glittered ones
but you could also not add glitter if
you want to use these for like shirts or
any article of clothing really something
that's gonna be washed you could just
design it on the plastic peel it off and
then stick it on a shirt or whatever but
anyway let's get started you'll need
puffy paint glitter plastic sheet
protectors or ziplock bags a printed-out
design and scrap paper if you're using a
printed out design or even one that you
drew yourself stick that paper into the
sheet protector or a ziploc bag this
will keep it in place as you work
I generally try to do the darkest colors
first and then finish with the lighter
colors so for this one it's the outline
first use your puffy paint to draw the
outline ideally you'd use a color that's
similar to the glitter color that you're
about to use like since I'm gonna use
black glitter I'd prefer to use a black
puffy paint or any kind of dark puffy
paint
unfortunately I'm running low on a few
of my puffy paint colors and those kind
of items puffy paint glitter adhesive
etc are slim pickins around this time of
year near me everyone else is decorating
for their cruise to take your outline
glitter color and sprinkle that on
covering the puffy paint completely dump
the excess glitter and tap it off onto
your scrap paper being careful not to
tap too hard the puffy paint is still
wet and especially if you put it on
thick it might start to slide and shift
gather the extra glitter by folding the
paper in half and pour it back into the
glare container then fill your next
color with puffy paint I'm doing the red
areas again sprinkle with the glitter
color of your choice dump tap and refill
that colors glitter if you find that
you're getting more of the previous
color glitter falling out still and you
don't want to muddy up the color that
you're on you can simply just pour that
into a new container I generally have
one container that's full of all of the
excess glitter anyway on to the next
color for me blue fill it in pour it on
dump tap and refill
then the lightest color again fill poor
dump tap and refill then I finished off
with the fire continue this with any
other design that you have I wanted to
do a little UFO so I sketched one out
really quick and then stuck that into
the sheet protector and made that one
[Music]
you can also freehand stuff if you want
you don't need to follow a pre drawn
design since I'm doing a space-themed I
thought that I'd make a few planets and
stars and why not basically I just put
down some circles sprinkled glitter
randomly I also made some comets in a
few stars some moons etc this stuff can
be as easy or hard as simple or
complicated as you want then let them
dry generally it takes at least
overnight or if you're puffy paint is
really thick it might take a few days
once they're dry they should easily peel
off the plastic
[Music]
then all you need to do is glue them on
to whatever you're decorating for me to
glue them on to the purses I prefer to
use e6000 if you're doing these for a
shirt or something first you probably
wouldn't want to use glitter and you
would just want to draw the designs with
colorful puffy paint but anyway to go on
to a shirt or something I would just use
some type of fabric glue
[Music]
but yeah so here's how my decorated
space-themed Nicks purse turned out
[Music]

don't know I'll have all the information
for it like right here but you should
definitely come out it's a good time
maybe you can catch one of my purses but
